channel.title: Vista Top Tip: How to get Telnet Back
channel.description: When debugging network issues, I tend to fallback to good old telnet as a way of opening a port to a machine.  Being able to do "telnet myserver 80" to check if a web server is up, listening, resolvable and no firewalls getting in...
channel.dc:creator: Martin

item.title: Comment by James Manning+00:00
item.description:
I always used netcat for such situations on my *nix machines, so I typically use the windows port. It's much more of a "Swiss army knife" kind of tool, especially in terms of piping random input/output and UDP.
http://www.securityfocus.com/tools/139
item.dc:creator: James Manning
